breweries.description:
Carolina Brewery is a locally-owned brewery and restaurant that has drawn international attention for its handcrafted beers, Our award-winning signature beers include Flagship IPA (Gold Medal, Great American Beer Festival), Copperline Amber Ale (Gold Medal, World Beer Championships), Sky Blue Golden Ale (Silver Medal, World Beer Championships), and Oatmeal Porter. We also offer a rotating list of seasonal brews. Our beers are now available on tap and in growlers and cans throughout North Carolina, so ask for them by name at your favorite bar, restaurant, or grocery store!

At our brewpubs in Chapel Hill and Pittsboro NC, you’ll discover authentic tastes in the glass and on the plate, a casual yet upscale atmosphere and affordable prices. Whether you’re looking for a place to grab a fresh beer with friends, enjoy a delicious meal, or host your next party, you’ve come to the right place. Carolina Brewery has been voted Best Brewpub in the Southeast by Brewpub magazine, and Best Burger in the Triangle by Independent Magazine and the readers of The Daily Tar Heel. But above all, we value the opinions of our customers, who cast their vote every time they return to our restaurant. We hope to see you soon. Cheers!

Proudly owned and operated by UNC alumni!

breweries.description:
The vision of Mary Ann and Mike Brigham – creating a neighborhood pub featuring hand-crafted beers brewed on site in gleaming copper tanks. The vision became a reality when the Brigham’s opened Ruth McGowan’s Brewpub in 2002. Since opening, Mary Ann and Mike remain hands-on owners

There are copper tanks which have become part of the Pub’s unique and cozy ambiance. Everyone who walks through the Pub doors is immediately made to feel at home by the friendly staff. The beers brewed on site have won many awards. All the elements of Mary Ann and Mike’s vision.

Brewmaster, Tim Gallagher, supplies the Pub with a selection of beer for any taste preference. Since Tim started brewing, he has created new popular beer recipes, production has more than doubled and their signature Cloverdale Ale has skyrocketed in popularity. CLOVER- DALE beer is now served on tap at several venues around the county, as well as sold in bottles at a number of retail outlets.

The Pub’s team (service staff, kitchen staff, Tim, Mary Ann and Mike) is dedicated to brewing the best hand-crafted beers, serving good food and keeping the atmosphere friendly.

Expansion is in the future to keep up with the demand for Ruth McGowan’s beer.
breweries.name: Ruth McGowans Brewpub

This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

breweries.description:
The Old Brewery at Tadcaster was established in 1758. It is Yorkshire’s oldest brewery. Traditional methods of brewing have been retained at The Old Brewery. The brewery still has its own cooper making and repairing all its oak casks. All Samuel Smith’s naturally conditioned draught beer is served from the wood. The original well at The Old Brewery, sunk in 1758, is still in use, with the brewing water being drawn from 85 feet underground.

Samuel Smith’s ales and stouts (except draught Sovereign and Extra Stout) are fermented in ‘stone Yorkshire squares’~ fermenting vessels made of solid slabs of slate ~ which give the beers a fuller bodied taste. 

The yeast used to ferment Samuel Smith’s ales has been of the same strain since the nineteenth century.  Samuel Smith’s grey Shire horses are stabled behind the Angel & White Horse, the pub next to the brewery.
breweries.name: Samuel Smith Old Brewery

data.description:
Brewed with well water (the original well at the Old Brewery, sunk in 1758, is still in use, with the hard well water being drawn from 85 feet underground); fermented in ‘stone Yorkshire squares’ to create an almost opaque, wonderfully silky and smooth textured ale with a complex medium dry palate and bittersweet finish.

Serving Suggestions • pizza and salad; pasta and other Italian foods; lobster with drawn butter; steak and kidney pie; ploughman’s lunch; dark flavourful bread; British and French cheeses.

Best served at about 55°F (13°C).

Ingredients • Water, malted barley, cane sugar, roasted malt, yeast, hops, oatmeal, seaweed finings, carbon dioxide.

breweries.description:
Located in historical Saratoga Springs, New York, the Olde Saratoga Brewing Co. has been a well-kept secret in the city.

Established in 1997, it is the fourth largest brewery in New York State and produces the highest quality and freshest craft brewed ales and lagers in the area.

The company is owned by the Mendocino Brewing Company, which is based in California. The Olde Saratoga Brewery brews about 30 different kinds of beer throughout the year - over 20,000 barrels last year. A third of their business is through contract brewing for a variety of breweries throughout the Northeast . Contract beers allow the brewery to make a variety of unique beers from light beer to a white Belgian to dark Stout beer and also gives the public a chance to taste of variety of great beers throughout the year.

breweries.description: Welcome to McCashin’s Brewery, home of New Zealand’s finest beverages. Our distinctive range of beverages is lovingly handcrafted from traditional recipes that have been the pride of the McCashin family for almost 30 years. We use only the finest natural ingredients, sourced mainly from the Nelson region of New Zealand, a region renowned for its organically rich soils and perfect climate. Our Palaeo water is amongst the purest in the world. And it is this water – along with our fresh, 100% pure ingredients – that give our beer, cider and spirits that uniquely refreshing flavour, which McCashin’s is famous for. Please take a tour of our website, and if you have any questions please contact us. We’d be delighted to hear from you.

breweries.description:
A long long time ago, in a far away place called North Carolina it all started. My great friend, and then neighbor, Randy and I decided it was time to start brewing beer since we could not longer get our then favorite brew in the stores. Our first beer was aptly named "Girly Beer" and was light and refreshing.

From there the brews continued until we were out of storage space. Our paths separated, but we each continued brewing. My brother Mike, soon took to brewing also and has been an avid brewer for many years now.

Background experience comes from homebrewing, being head brewer at Hal and Mal's in Jackson, MS, and head brewer at Riverhorse, in Lambertville, NJ.

breweries.description:
Deep Water Brewing Co. is our very own three barrel microbrewery.  While the actual brewery is currently off site in Brooklin, it will soon be located behind the Arborvine.

At Deep Water we personally handcraft each and every beer from the best ingredients available. Right now, we serve our beers exclusively at the Arborvine and the Vinery.

Being small allows us to experiment. We brew a number of styles and try to keep them rotating throughout the summer.

Primarily, we brew ales, namely: Pale Ale, Double IPA, Amber Ale, Porter, Oatmeal Stout (coming soon), and British mild.

For special occasions, though, we have been known to break out a keg of lager or two.  In the past we've served: Bohemian Pilsner and Octoberfest (Marzen).  Sometime this summer we will debut our Vienna Lager.

breweries.description:
Colorado has long been the center of the craft beer movement, and with a new Colorado brewery to visit seemingly every week, that movement is in full swing. We hope to serve as a launchpad for the next generation of Colorado beer. In addition to our own beers, Grandma's House allows other aspiring breweries the opportunity to create their beers on our brewing system and sell them through the taproom. Our guests enjoy an ever-changing tap list from multiple breweries all producing under the same roof.

As Grandma's House has progressed from concept toward reality, we've had the pleasure of visiting craft events all over the Denver area and have been blown away by the diverse community of artisans right here in our own backyard. We aspire to become one small part of this community and help it to grow. Grandma's House will showcase the amazing products made by small producers right here in Colorado. We will partner with other craft-related businesses for regular events at the brewery

breweries.description:
Schlafly is the brand name of beers produced by the Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. Currently, all beers produced by this brewery are under the Schlafly brand. Located in St. Louis, Missouri, it is widely available in Eastern Missouri and Southern Illinois. Schlafly brand beers are distributed to the following states: Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Western Mississippi, North Virgina, and Washington, DC.

The Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. was incorporated in 1989. It was founded by Dan Kopman and Tom Schlafly,[1] a lawyer and nephew of political activist Phyllis Schlafly, although she is not involved with the brewery in any way. Their goal was to create quality local microbrew beer.

data.description: Oats aren’t just for breakfast you know? Commonly referred to as a “meal in a glass,” our Oatmeal Stout is definitely the one meal of the day you should not miss. A rich, deeply malted extravaganza of a beer, Blue Point Brewing’s Oatmeal Stout is a dark beer drinker’s dream come true. We use pale, crystal, chocolate, and roasted malts with just the right amount of flaked oats added to produce an uncommonly silky brew. This full-flavored and rich tasting legendary dark beer is a romantically delicious microbrew to share with someone special, at anytime of the day or evening.
data.name: Oatmeal Stout

breweries.description:
Starting out in 1998 as two guys with a dog, a van, and a dream, Blue Point Brewing Company quickly became one of the nation’s premier microbreweries. After first launching our lightly toasted, complex, full-flavored Toasted Lager, we rapidly gained the respect of beer lovers far and wide. Soon after, we introduced several other brews and were being compared to breweries from noted craft-brewing capitals like Denver, Boston, Portland, and Seattle.

Brewing isn’t just our business, it’s our passion. We’re beer people. We started Blue Point Brewing Company because we wanted to make beer we would drink. To quench that desire, we select only top-quality ingredients and brew all-natural, unpasteurized beer. It’s this approach that put us on the world beer map. From the World Beer Cup to the Great American Beer Festival and the Australian International Beer Awards – we’re becoming noticed the world over. But we believe you should be the judge. Let us know what you think.

breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

data.description: The notion that Stout was full of goodness encouraged the practice of prescribing Stout for medical purposes and this in turn brought about the trend of “Food Stouts”. The addition of 10% oatmeal gives this ale a distinctive smooth and silky mouth feel, and yes, it’s not just for breakfast anymore.

breweries.description:
Longwood Brew Pub & Restaurant stands proud as the "jewel in the crown" of Longwood Station. Nestled within beautiful landscaping and natural west coast wilderness the Longwood Brew Pub is easily accessible via the Nanaimo Parkway from Victoria or Duke Point ferry terminal or the old Island Highway from Departure Bay ferry terminal and all points north. Longwood Brew Pub is central Vancouver Island's first Brew Pub and Nanaimo's favorite rendezvous destination.

The Brewery at the Longwood stands proud as one of the first images that you will see as you enter the main entrance. The Primary Brew House is located behind storefront glass on the left of our host- stand and is a flurry of activity as our brewer Harley Smith creates his magic and art 3 to 4 times a week. Every Saturday is tour day with reservations requested for the ever-popular 3:00 pm brewery tour and tasting. Only those patrons 19 or older may participate in the tasting component of the tour.
breweries.name: Longwood Brewpub

style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.
style.name: American-Style Stout

data.description: No affectations, and certainly no gimmicks. Brewed truly to style, the aroma of bakers chocolate and fresh roasted coffee playfully waft from the glass. A rich blend of kilned malts give way to creamy caramel, subtle roastiness, and a hint of vanilla. The oats impart depth of character and a velveteen texture that rounds out all the flavors. Recommended pairings: Nutella filled crepes with shaved hazelnuts and a dusting of cocoa powder. Or as an appetizer, warm sourdough bread with Gruyer.

breweries.description: When Roc Brewing Co. began in the crisp cellaring walls of a suburban Rochester basement, they never imaged the future that was set forward. The ever infectious brewing bug had bitten both homebrewers Jonathan Mervine and Chris Spinelli. From the time the yeast was pitched it was unanimous this was their future. Joined by the emboldened encouragement of Chris’ mom and third partner Patty Spinelli, she was hooked by first sip. The new family began their many trials and tribulations of brewing, three tier law, legalese and to much to their chagrin ROC Brewing Co. was founded.

breweries.description:
From the self-performed renovation to the custom-fabricated brew train, Appleton Beer Factory was built to immerse patrons in beer culture & display the brewing process. We’re proud of our beer & want you to witness its journey from tun to tongue.

We have an obvious and delicious priority – beer. Our goal is to put top-notch brew in your glass while putting you in a friendly and fun atmosphere. Appleton Beer Factory beers are crafted to deliver what is so often missing from many beers on the market today – balance. This balance was struck from passionate experimentation by knowledgeable brewers who have focused on respecting the ingredients they use and the people they serve.

data.description: Our Oatmeal Stout is so named for the 10% oat content of the grains. You will find this stout to pour black with a nice thick head that remains. As you taste this beer you will find coffee and dark chocolate as the dominating flavors with a sweet finale. We left this beer with a lighter carbonation so you can enjoy the true flavor of this beer that we find tastes its best between 50-55°F.

breweries.description: Set in the heart of the Midwest, the Hub City Brewing Company is located five miles east of the historic town of Oelwein, Iowa. Founded in 1872 on a plot of land nestled amongst the fields, the city served as a hub for three major branches of the Chicago Great Western Railway, earning it the nickname of "Hub City" during the heyday of the railroad. Our beers pay homage to this historic Iowa town and the romantic era of the iron horse.

breweries.description:
The 7Barrel was opened April 20, 1994 by renowned brewer Gregory J.  Noonan. While Greg is no longer with us, his tradition lives on through the dedicated patrons that enjoy the unique, friendly atmosphere of a neighborhood pub and brewery.  In continuing this tradition, the 7Barrel family welcomes you to visit us and celebrate our 20 years in the neighborhood.

Under the ownership of Upper Valley locals since 2010, we here at the 7Barrel are focused on continuing to provide our customers with high quality fare, great craft beer, and the enjoyable and unique atmosphere people have come to expect from our establishment. 

Visit our website and like us on Facebook to stay in the know with all of latest news and event dates.

breweries.description:
Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale). 

In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery. 

In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works. 

The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others. 

Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.

Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews. 

Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.

www.troegs.com
